column2: Amazon rides open road with few bumps NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - The open road in front of Amazon has few bumps. The $500 billion internet retailer reported top-line growth up a riveting 25 percent to $38 billion in the second quarter. Investors will fret about the sky-high valuation in relation to a bottom line that plunged 77 percent from a year earlier to under $200 million in the quarter. But feedback loops within the company keep rivals at bay. ~Amazon's Jeff Bezos becomes world's richest: Forbes Amazon.com Inc  Chief Executive Jeff Bezos has unseated fellow tech billionaire Bill Gates as the richest person in the world
